titleStmt.title: CW 105
titleStmt.author: Carmichael, Alexander Archibald (1832‐1912)
titleStmt.sponsor: Edinburgh University Library and the Department of Scottish and Celtic Studies

interpretation.p: All digital surrogates of the original source are linked with the markup textfile.
All Gaelic (and English) texts have an English summary, index terms, keywords, and, where applicable, a taxonomic reference.
For some Gaelic (and English) texts a bibliographic reference(s) will be provided to other sources.

correction.p: Errors from the original source transcription have been kept to a minimum by employing stringent quality control procedures. In addition, all texts have been proof‐read by the text editors.

A guiding principle of the Alexander Carmichael notebooks markup procedure is to approximate the original document as closely as possible, so that the character of Carmichael's transcriptions is preserved along with its content. XML (eXtensible Markup Language), with its capacity to convey emendations such as deletions (crossed out) and supralinear additions and so forth, can digitally reproduce an authentic version which reflects the source documents.
Where authorial changes, e.g. substitution, have occurred in the text then this has been annotated.
Where there are errors they have been corrected and words which were difficulty to decipher has been indicated

In such cases missing words or letters have been supplied. Quotation marks and other missing grammatical marks have in the main not been supplied. Where there are gaps in the text usually because the word was inaudible (some background noise, perhaps) or where the transcriber could not make out what was being said in the act of transcription (perhaps the speaker was inarticulate or mumbling or for whatever reason) then these have been tagged, though not explained; where a word is now difficult, illegible or just unclear, then this has also been tagged.
All such changes have been annotated in accordance with TEI 5 procedures.

normalization.p: No normalization of the words such as changing the source text to conform with current Gaelic orthographic conventions has been undertaken. The texts are as given with only minor editorial changes. in order to preserve the integrity of the original texts.

quotation.p: All opening quotation marks, hyphens, dashes, apostrophes, periods, colons, etc. have been retained in the source text and have been encoded in accodance with ISO entity references, etc.
All double marks have been processed using straight quotation marks, that is, ". All single quotation marks have been rendered using apostrophe.

hyphenation.p: End‐of‐line hyphenation has been retained. All unambiguous end‐of‐line hyphens have been retained, and the trailing part of a word has not been joined to the preceding line.of‐line hyphenation has been retained. All unambiguous end‐of‐line hyphens have been retained, and the trailing part of a word has not been joined to the preceding line.

segmentation.p: Folio numbers have been added in pencil at the top of each notebook page are retained using the pb (pagebreak) element together with the n attribute for the page number and the ed attribute to specify the edition.
When an tale‐text or song which, more often than not, fills more than one page, it is segmented with page break.

langUsage.language: Approximately 40% of the fieldnote and transcription bokos are Scottish Gaelic, and the remaining 60% consist of English or Scots, along with stray quotations in Latin.

JulJuly 5 1865
le Callum Mac Rath ciobair aig Fear
Heusinnnis ann an Abhuinn Suidhe.

Bha righ ann roimhe so, agus bha gleann gam ainm righ an Domhain
aige go eich agus bha buachaille aige ri na
h-eich anns a ghleann dham buin O
Croileagan bocbochd nan each Cha rorobh duine
chuideacchuideachd aige fuireach colacomhla ris eich e fhein
sa chuid coin. Bha bachabathach mor aige anns
an rorobh e fuireach agus anns am
bhiodh e cuir a staigh an oicheoidhche rheodh
fiach a chuid bu bhocabhochda do na h-
eich. Dh-eirich e madainn mhoch
agus thog na coin lorg air an duine
gus an do chuir Lean na coin
an lorg gus an do chuir iad an
lorg a staigh ann an cam Doire
a bha na coin a cruachdain eir
a bheist a staigh leum e sin na
gearr dhuinn ghlass ann an Sgriobhte ri taobh tomain na grobain anns
Bheinne-tuath annn na h-Earradh air
feasgar Diciadain Jul 5 lalatha 1865
le Alasdair AArchibald MacIllemhicheil
Airiste le Calum Mac Rath ciobair
aig Fear Huisinis ann Amhainn
Suidhe.
The reciter of this – Malcolm
MacRae – shepherd died suddenly
at Amhuinn-suidhe. HeeHe was
after taking some bread and milk when
he leant back in his chair and
expirededexpired in the summer of 1866.
He was an honest decent man. A.Alexander A.Archibald C.Carmichael
an achlais O Croileagan. Rinn e foin
mor ris a so gus an tugadh dhach
aigh e gu mhaighstir s gun bhana
mhaighstir. Air a sin air an
tslighe dol dachaigh bha i fas rud-
eiginn trom air agus thug e lasach
adh air di agus sheall e oirre agus
gu de bha aige ach am boirionnach
bhu bu bhriagha chunnaig suil bho
thus an domhain gu deireadh an
t-saoghail. Thug e sin trì cuidreanan
an a ghaoil anama dhi agus
gur h-ann a dh-fheumadh e
a bhi connanachadh agus i anns
an uair. Cha'n e sin is fhearrra dhut
a dheanadh O CCroileagan – ars ise. Ach bitheadh
mise agaa mar mhnaois 's mar
leannan mar dh-iarras thu
ma ni thu mo thir iarratas
an. Chan'n 'eil iarratas sam bith
a dh-iarras thu orm nach deant mi –
abair iad. Le sin ma tha gur thu
chanain na caile rium gun
thu dh-iarraidh righ saoghalta
chun do thighe agus gun thu chiu
mar athair orm gun tig thu
riamh a' bial nan con mora mi.
Bha siud ulladh gu elor do O CCroileagan

Bha iad a so a dol air aghart dach
aigh thun an tighe. Agus aite an tseann
bhaitheach dhiridh s e bha aige an treoine
bhiagh gheal bu bhriadhe de chunnaic
suil riamh – nach so leithid aig an
righ fhein. I ars easa bha mi an
duile gugun rorobh mi gle eolach anns an
rathad seo ach th ami faicinnin gur
h-ann a chaidh mi air iomaraull
Gu de is ciall da sin" Thu tha an
treoic (treothaic) tha mi faicinfaicinn nach
a bheil a leithid aig an righ fhein
Na biodh sin a cur ionnaidh sam bith
ort ars ise – Cha neil a sin ach toiseach
mo thochairse tighinn dachaidh gad
d-ionnsaidh." Chuir e iad a so air
aghart chun an tighe. Doir a rain
ig iad a sin an tigh bha na buird air
an cuirigeadh le bh biadh dhe gach
biadh agus deoch dhe gach deoch ceol an
dhe gach ceol agus bu choma de
an seomar dhe an taigh anns an
suideadh iad (suise). Dh fasDh fhas
O CCroileagan bocbochd nan each cho uaibhreach
mu dheireadh agus nach rorobh moran
suim dhe na h-eich fhein. Cha
rorobh ni air bord a mhaighstir nach
rorobh cho math aige agus bha e ga
fhaicinn fhefhein cocho math ris an righ.
Dean e mar sin fad bhliannabliadhna. An
ceann na bliannabliadhna chaidh e mach
a ghobhail came ceum Doir
thairg thainig e sin a stigh shuishuidh
e agus leig e uilinn air a bhord. Thainig
a sin bean a tighe ga ionnsuidh
agus thuirt i ris Gu de an sprog
tha air O CCroileagan an diugh nach bheil
e gobhail a bhreicfast? S mor sin
a cuir orm. A chaill mar sidsiod 's mar
so tha thu ann, mar tugainns a'
bial nan con mor thu dh-faodainndh-fhaodainn
mo righ saoghalta thoirt thun mo
thaighe gu cuid oicheoidhche. Tha bu
bi masa na biodh sin a cur grunan
ain sam bith oirt ars ise. Suidh
aig do bhiadh agus gabh e agus
faodaidh thu falbh san uair ga
chuireadh agus dh-fhaoite nach
ainnich e chiad chuid an
oicheoidhche nach ann aig a taigh
fhein a bhios e cuideaccuideachd. Ghobh
a bhiadh gu sunndach s dh' fola e
s rainig i a righ gu sunntach
aigeanachaigeannach. Chaidh e air a ghluin
ean an righ a deanadh iarratas
air. O chiod so O CCroileagan bhocbhochd tha tighinn
riut Cha n bheil iarratas sam bibith
tha comasch dhomhsa nach
dean mi dhuit. Se sin sipfhein
sipein sa'r cuirt sar cuideaccuideachd
a dhol cuid oicheoidhche dh-ionnsuidh
mo thaighe. Se sin a tha smo rud
mo ruis agus mo chuirt agus
mo chuideacchuideachd a dhol cuide riutse
oicheoidhche dh-ionnsuidh do thighe
Ach theid mi fhein agus mo
ghillghille leat. Dh falbhDh fhalbh iad a sin

a bhi treis air an astar thuirt
O CCroileagan. Gabhadh mo leithsgeul
rinn mi diochumhin. Bith
ibh sibhse gabhail cum air aghart
gus am beir mi oirbh. Dar thill e so air ais dh-eubh e gun rorobh an
righ a g-iarraidh air a chuirt agus
air a chuideacchuideachd a leanailt ga be air
bi aite s an rorobh e fhein gu bhi nocnochd.
Dh-folbhDh-fholbh iad a seo as a dheigh – air
feac mar a bha i. Rainig iad
a sin tigh O CCroileagan Bha ann a sin
biadh dhe gach biach agus deoch

ceol agus bu choma co an sum
an suidhe a dh aire righ agus cha
robh sum san taigh aig e fhein coltach
ris na suim an tigh O CCroileagan na
cuinn cho freagarrach agus
bean O CCroileagan a fhrithealadh do gach aon
agus seomar agus gach fear
a saoillsin gur h-ann leis fhein i.
Bha an righ an duil nach rorobh i
falbh as an uine an so e fhein
agus bha O CCroileagan an duil &c agus
bha gille an righ an duil agus
bha chuilchuile fear an duil nach
so i dol as an rum an rorobh e fhein
agus gun gaol a ghabh i air fhein
Bha chuirm a dol air aghart fad
na h-oicheh-oidhche gus soillse a lalatha gus
an tainig am a dhol a laidhe
Bha leaba fhein fregarrach do na
chuile fear – aon na dha no tri
no sia no deich &c leaba do'n
gach buidhean air an lionaraclionarachd
Dh-fasDh-fhas gille an righ a seo bocbochd tintinn. Se
b ainm da Céin O Lugain. Agus
on na tha e bocbochd dh-fheumadh e leaba
dha fhein agus si a fhuair e
Agus on na bha e bocbochd tintinn chuir
bean O CCroileagan ga chuir a laidhe. Doir
a bha i ga chuir a laidhe sann
a rug thu oirre a Chein O Lugain
ga toirt an laidhe leat. Se sin
duisealinn a bh air. Cha b-ann
air chladhaineac a chaidh sidsiod
dh ise. Ri Thug i togail dha cois
agus bhuail e e san lurgain agus
rinn i da leth dhi. Chaidh an
so an tigh gu tamh gu cadal
agus gu fois. Ach se be dusg
adh madaine dhaibh gaoth
sian us doirrean an t-side nach
tig s nach teirig agus gun
sgial an clach dhun treoirc ghil
no air slait an bhatheacha dhubh
ach a dha no tri chromagan bha
os cionn an righ agus O CCroileagan. Be na
cluasgan cadail daibh meall
a bhuachar nan each. A sireadh
an tsluaigh anns an digean
agus anns na claisean. dha'n
tional anns an tseana bhatheach
dhuibh. Gus an dh-fuaradhdh-fhuaradh
uile iad mu dheireadh ach Cein
Ol O LLurgain bocbochd. Fhuaireadh e mu
dheireadh ann an claise
an tsean bhatheach dhuibh
agus a lurgain briste. Dh-innis
Cha rorobh sgial air a bhoireannach
mhaiseach bean O CCroileagan Dh-innis
le O Lurgain gur h i bhuail breab air
agus a bhirst a chas. Bhuail
eadh a so air CCein O LLurgain gur he thug
an truaighe so air an taigh agus
bhatar gu chuir gu bas. Thainig
sean Ach bha sean duine lea
anns a chuideacchuideachd agus sann
e chomhairlich e le O LLurgain air
chuir gu io eilean iomallach
an iomal an domhain mhoir
agus lon lalatha o bhu bliannabliadhna chuir
leis agus daoine chuir ga
shealltain a sin feuch am
marbh nam beo e. Se so
chaidh a dheanamh – chaichaidh
comhairl an t-sean duine

sgriobar chuir le O CCein O LugLurgain
do dh-eilean iomallach
an iomal an domhain
mhoir.

Thainig BaBha CCein O LLurgain san eilean
agus sean duine lialiath ga ionnsuidh
gus dh-eubh e ris. Sin do chas
a Chein gus an teid barr luibh
leubh agus leathais rithe –
ceasain furtacfurtachdgu slainte gus
am bi coromcothrom siubhal agus
iomaciomachd agad. Ta ars Cein
nan bu cas domh fhein i nam
bu cas na deigh i ma theid barr
luidhe na leighe no leathais ri
na cearain furtacfurtachd gu slainte
gus an cluinn mise sgiala
beag neo-thana neonach nach
cuala mi roimhe riamh no
ciamar a dh-eirich do bhean
O Croileagan o'n lalatha sin." "Ta is duine dondona
thu le agus is duine dondona thu
gun amhras agus a liuthad
duine san domhnainn leis am
bu shuarach tighinn ga bea
le leathas da t-ionnsuidh.
Ach bho'n as duine bocbochd thusthusa le –
a bhios ann a so leat fhein
tha mismise togaitogail sgiala beag neo-
anathana neonach nach cuala tu roimhe
riamh innseadh dhuit. Cha
n i bean O CCroileagan a bha ann ansanns an
sean duine. Ach ban righ
an domhain agus nighean
righ nan tallacha dearga agus
fad na bhanna dha bha i le O CCroileagan bha
i air falbh o Righ an domhainn
agus tha i nis an deidh dhol dachai
gh ionnsuidh agus i toirt cuirm
mhor ga chuid sheirbheiseach.

Bha moran ghaisgeach aig an
righ ach bha triuir lan agas shar
ghaisgeach aige Sir Sallabha
Corrna-breac agus Macan a' Ghluine
Duibh agus Macan-na-faillire
deirge – ri gaisgeacgaisgeachd. Thuirt isise
sidsiod B' ann a sidsiod agaibh a nis gaisg
ich agus sar ghaisgghaisgich agus lan ghaisgich
ach feach am bheil ainm fhear
nam measg a dh-innseaddh-innseadh domhsa
gu de tha Mac an Righ nan srol
deanamh air Beallach ach

gach fear roimh chluais na
luaran ach aon duine tapaidh

fhein gum bu taireach leis
nach biodh fios aige gu de
bha Macan Righ na streoil a
deanamh. Dh eirich e moch
sa mhaduinn agus chaidh
e na dheise gun iomal agus
airm gun iomal chuir e
sgia bhuacaideac bhacaideacbhacaideachd
chualchuala dualaich air a laimh

aghaidh na bruthaich a thug e
le ceumana na mine tostail
fhein gun rorobh cho math dha

agus tachairt ris anns an
am sin gus an deach e air
aghart agus am fac e an
obair a bh aig Macan dh na sheoilna Teine
Thug e greis ga chomhail. Agus
se an obair a bha aige. Bha e na
sheasamh anns a bheallach agus
aghaidh ris an airde iar agus
a chulaobh san airde an ear
agus bha geilleag mhor iarrainn
aige agus thilgeadh e bhuaidhe

i ristrithist ga ionnsuidh na straoill
straoillichean dearga teine agus

Ach smaoinich e so Sior Salla
bha air fhein mar biodh comh
radh sam bibith aig uaibhreach
creidte gum fac e idir e. Ghobh
e air aghart ga ionnsuidh mu
gho sin a bha an cath gun chairs
eas eadar na fir gus an t so

an ceann air an amhaich agus

Thoisich an cath a nist mar
a bha e roimhe gus an do chuir
SSir Sallabha bha an ceann deth an
darna turas. Leum an ceann
air an amhaich a ristrithist agus

agus thuirt e ris 'S iongadach
leam saighdeir cho math
riutsa Shoir ShShallabha nach cuireadh
tu an leine air an amhaich
gus an reobhadh an fhuil.
Boid us briathran dorchsa
mar dean mi sin ma gheobh
mise dheth fhathast. Chuir
e sin an ceann uair eile dhe
agus gu grad chuir e an leinleine
air an amhaich. Thug an
ceann tri leuman dhi n lailaigh ad

shroil agus rainig a e dhachaigh
air ais. Seadh ars a bhan righ am
facfaca thu nis gu deart bha Mac
an na Leine Sroil a deanamh?"
Ta chunna mi sin cuideaccuideachd ars
easan. Gad a chunna tustusa eise
cha'n fhacfhaca eiseise tusa. U char
U chunnaig e sin cuideaccuideachd
Ciod an comharrach a bheir
thu dhomh gum facfaca. Tha 'n
ceann a bheir amhaich agam."
Ciod tuille? "Air leine bheir a
dhuine agam. Nach toir thu
dhomh fhein an ceann? Cha
toir – cha b ann mac sin a
fhuair mi fhein e." Nach
toir thu dhomh an leine? Tha
mi coma gad a bheirinn duit
an leine. "Nach toir thu dhomh
a nis tri pogan dhe an cheann
"Bheir." Bha cuaileinnean mora
fuilt air a cheann agus shuaine
e sud mu ma dha dhorn agus
shin e an ceann na coineamh
Shin ise a da lairmh an coin
eamh an ceann agus dh-fagdh-fhag
i am falt aige fhein agus dh-
falbhdh-fhalbh i na calman glas a nuas
air fh fharlas agus cha rorobh fios
co dhiu san 's e n talamh a mhain
non e an t athai an ard thug
i oirre. Thoisich an righ a sidsiod
air troid ris gun do chuir
e a bhan air falbh air agus nach
faighte gu sioraidh tuille i.

A man at Boisdale is said
to have this tale. He was building
the policeman's house at Loch-
maddy.

Patrick Smith SSouth Boisdale
a fine old sgialaiche has
this sgialacsgialachd along with many
more A.Alexander A.Archibald C.Carmichael 25 MarMarch 1870

div.title: Bas Osgair
div.p:
Bha an Fheinn o thigh agus cha
rorobh duine aig an taigh ach Osgar
Chuir an Cairbre ruadh fios air
Osgar gu dinnear. Thoisich iad
air an dinndinnear agus thuirt an
Cairbre ruadh le bosd nach rorobh
seud a shiradh easan ach faigh
eadh e

lg.l: Se fa mun iarra tus orm e
Mise an diugh bhi gun Fheinn gun athair
Ged bhiod an Fheinn us t athair cho math
Sa bha iad riamh cha b uillear leam gach
Seud a dh-iarran gum faighinn.
Tharruinn e sin leac fichedfichead b fear bogha
Thainig e fhei eir ard an domhain
S thuit sud le lamh Osgair thall
Se mosgladh ri Righ Eirinn
Leac ficheafichead do fearaibh sheac
Thainig o thu fhuar an d sneacsneachd
Thuit sid o loimh Oscair thall
Se mosgladh ri Righ Eirinn
Mungan mac Serice chomhraigeadh e
Ciad claiclaidheamh glas na onraconrachd
Thug an t-Osgar uachair eiel a null
S thuiteadh leis an Cairbre ruaruadh Righ Eirinn
Cha rorobh duine beo an uair sin ach
Art mac a Chairbre agus thuirt Osgar

div.p:
Eirich Art 'us tog do chlaichlaidheamh seas ann
an aite d' athar s mu thig thu beo
ors an larach canaidh mi gura mac
Righ thu. Thug an t Art leum as a
null agus chuir e l sleigh nan seacseachd
seang eadar airnean agus imleag
an Osagir. Thug an t Osgar an leum
as a null agus chuir e sleigh nan
naogh seang mu choineamh fhuilt
agus eudain.

Thuit Osgar air a ghlun agus chuir
e foirm mor agus faodhar ann a tighinn
Thainig a sin Fionn agus thuit e cha mheasa
tha thu an diugh no lac caitha Beinne
Eudain Snamhach na corran romh
do chneas s i mo lamhsa rinn do
leathas

lg.l: Mo leathas cha n eil e am fath
S cha mhu nitear e gu brach
Chuir an t-Art mac a Chairbre
An t Sleagh nimhe nan seacseachd seanguin
eadar m'ainmean agus m imleag.
S thug mis an urchair eil a null
S chuir mi sleagh nimhe nan naogh
Mu choineananich fhuilt agus eudan.
Thugaibh leibh mi gu tulaich ghorm ghlas
Gus tariribh buiribh dhiom an t-aodoch.

div.p:
Agus cha ghearraineadh an FhFheinn
bas Osgair nan rorobh duinne beo sa
lair air an dioladh iad bas Osgair

He heard these duans from Ruairi
Mac Cuinn who lived at Malacleit
and who had a free piece of land these from
the proprietor for his duans.

div.title: Duan na Ceardach
div.p:
le Iain DonullachDomhnullach Lochephort
OctOctober 2, 1865

lg.l: LaLatha dhuinn air Luachair-Leothair
An ceararceathrar chronan a bhruithin
Mi fhein us Osgar us Daorghlas
Sa Us Fionn fheinn ann be Mac Cumhail
Chunnacas a tighinn a'm mhunadh
Fear fada dugh 'se air aona chois
Le mhuntal dugh ciar-dhugh craicionn
Us apran an eideadh chian air
Labhair Fionn a bha sa mhunadh
Ris an urra bha dol seachad
Cait a thusa bheil do mhunadh
Na fhir a tha do chulain chas chracain?
Duan Mac Cribh, Ribh a bainm baiste
Nam biodh agad orm bealbeacbeachd sgeula
Far Bha mi t ri uallach ghobhain
Aig Righ Lochlain anns a Gheilbhine
Labhair nighean Iain diugh ic Asgail
Bh Bu mhath i air thus na cloinne
Bu niarac bean an aona mhathair
Dhomh fhein s dha an aona bhrathair eile
Shin iad a mach air an t-siubhal
Air a bhuithean choige luimneachh
Air sleagh dh dugh-ghorm 's iad mar pheathar
Gun deach iad nan Catha bruithnich
Bu bhuidhean dur sud an gobha
Bu bhuidhean eile dhiu Daorghlas
Bu dur Dearg Mac Reathein
Us Fionn nan deoigh s e na aonar
Cha lotadh an gobh ach aona cheum
Air gach ghleannan siaraidh fasaich
Cha n fhaiceadh iad ach air eiginn
Sgod da eideadh thar a mhasan
Fosgail Fosgail e ors Daorghlas
Chan fhagain thu an dorus ceardaich
Air aite gàbhaid stu nad aonar
Gun d' fuaird' fhuair iad am builg ri sheideadh
Gun d fuaird fhuair iad ann eigin cheardach
Gun d fuaird fhuair iad ann cerar ghobhnean

div.title: AisligAisling Righ Breatinn
div.p:
Chunnaig Righ Breatuin bruadar air
boirinneach ailliaillidh agus bha i tamh
an caisteal a meadhon a
chuain. ChaiChaidh e ga faicinn agus
chuir i dhi e mum d-fagd-fhag e i.

lg.l: Chunnaig Righ Breatuin na shuain
An aona bhean a b-fearrb-fhearr snuagh fo'n ghreine
S gum fear leis tachairt na cionn
Na comhrag fir mar e fhein
Labhair Sior Falaich gu fial
Theid mi fhifhin ga h-iarraidh dhuit
Labair Sior Falaich gu fial
Theid mi fhifhin ga h-iarraidh dhuit
Mi fhefhein s mo ghille s mo chu
Nach triuir a dh-iarraidh na mna
Mi fhifhin s mo ghille s mo chu na triuir
Nar triuir a shireadh na mnimnaoi
Bha sinne seacseachd seacuinean s tu mios
Bha sinne sgith ri siu'al cuain
Mun facas cala na fonn
Na aite san gabhadh an long tamh
Mach gu meadhoin a chuain mhoir
Chunnacas caisteal min gheal gorm
Uinneagin glioin air a stuaigh
'S bu lionar ann cuach us corn.
A tearnadh dhuinne gu bhun
Thainig slamhraidh dhugh a nuas
Eagal cha do ghabh mi no fiamh
Ghabh mi oirnne an dhian ruith suas
Chunnacas a bhean bheul dearg og
Ann an cathair oir s i stigh
Strea fonn sioda fo da bhonn
Ann an cathair oir s i stigh
1> Cruit air an uc na h-ighnne ghil ur
Asguinne suil sa gile deud
Seo brinn s gan seinneadh i cruit
Bha bhinne ro sin guth a bheuil
Thuit easan na shioram suain
An deigh bhi cuartachadh chuain ghairbh
Chea'ail iad a shluagh gu leir
S bha bhean fhefhein fo chuidh a chuim
Ghoid iad an clia geur claiclaidheamh ceir no geur o thaobh
S gun chuir iad dheth fhe dhiai fhefhein na cinn
Sin agai agaibh deireadh mo sgeoil
S mar a sheinneadh anm bron binn.
Tro-ud s cuir mo do cheann air mo ghlun
S gun seinnin duit ceol us ciuil

div.title: Duan an Deirg
div.p:
Transcribed
May 4 1869 A.Alexander A.Archibald C.Carmichael
leis an Catrine ciadna, OctOctober 5, 1865

Phos Padruig ann Salm – a chiad
fhear thug an soisgeul riamh
a dh-Eirinn – nighean Osein.
Bhitheadh e sgriobhadh duain
Osein agus bha moran aige sgriobhte
dhiu. Feasgar oicheoidhche Chollaig
shuidh Padruig a stiagh an deigh
dha an scoil le a leigeil a mach
agus thuit e ri OsOsein – "Gabh duan
air an Fheinn. Sann a sin
a thuirt Osein –

lg.l: Tha sgeul agam air Chonn mac an Deirg
An a lioneadh le trom fheirg
Dol a dhioladh torrac athair gun fheall
Air chrochaibh ro mhor na h-Eireann
Innis sid Osein naraich
A chinn shuairce roi ro sho-ghradhaich
Sgeul air Chonn Fearadhaigh feacail
An laoch calma caoin ghreanail
Co bu mhu Conn na Dearg
Bu mhu Conn l gum or mor

S na tu bu mheasa dreach dhaibh
nan dealg dealbh

Gum b'e Dearg am
fear meinmneach.
Gruaidh chorcar mar iuthar caoin
Rosg mall agus mala chorra-chaol
Flat o'n geaurrt an ail mhor ghuinn meinmnich
{Fhearaibh leubhnich Earradh leobhair air a laoch gu anreit (aireit) –
Buaigh gach aite robhe e riamh
Air ghaisge san s air mhor ghniamh
Ga'ail sgreamh gun chomhrag sgios chomhairidh
Togail chreach agus mhor chios
Nuair chunnaig iad conmhag Chuinn
Mar ghuairm tuinne na treun {tuim {tuinn

S e tighinn gu athair a dhuitheilt
Bheirsesa mo bhiar dhuisa Chadaig
Ga bu nar e ri inns e
Gun do ghabh na Fianntaich dh-eagal

Ni nach do ghabh iad riamh romh
aon duine
Losdan seac fichead fear mor
Aobhar turs agus to-dru broin (do-broin)

Agus Fionn fo throme fheirg
Ghluais an coig ciad
Do dh-fearaibhdh-fhearaibh dianasach
An coin{eamh eadh Chuinne mhoir
Bhuadhaich bhrais s e cailgeadh a sgiath
Chuireadh e fu-annun nan

niāl air chrith os an cinn san
anabhailt.
B' iorman sid sa bhair a bhos
Bu lionnar leleth lamh s leleth chos
Bu lionar le coluncolunn gun cheann
Aig fear a choigeal [infralinear: choigealdhchoigealadhle aon néinng
Thuit iad sidsiod air coig ciad eile
Ge bhiodh iad san aon-laraich.
Leigte mise ga ionnsuidh
Arsa Conan mac Morna
S gun sgarrain a cheann a chuim
Diamhas a chuaibheadh

Nuair chunnaig e Conon dol
a sileadh an armudh
Thug e sitheadh gu thaobh
Se tighinn gu h-eall ealadhan
S iomadh cnap s is iomadh meall
Bha g-eirīridh suas air an droch ceann
Air maol Chonan gu reamhar
Na coig chaol 's an aro aona chea'ill
BeannacBeannachd an laimh a bhoin dhuit
Labhar Fionn le fiomh romhaidh
Gum b'e turas dhuit gun eiridh phromh-nosg
Labhair Osgar nam mor long Gholl ghlonn
Fhir a chaisg air torractorrachd riamh
Ghoill 'ic Morna nam mor ghniomh
A mhiann sula gach a paile
Sa phrionsaphrionnsa na teugmhallach
A thoir}Boin} nan ceann gu fearail dhuit
Mar thug thu dha athair romhairomhaidh
Dheanais sid duits Fhinn
Am briarabriatharan taoghta ro ghrinne
Ach fuacfuachd us follacfollachd chuir air chul
'San Fheinn uile bhi dhaon run
Ghluais fuil us fearg us Fraoch
An dail a cheil an diis distdithist laoch
A b' aite gniomh
Le m' beumanan bu leoir am meud
'San Fheinn uile gan cumhaic
Ga'n cubhair leig an Fheinn
Agus Fionn n an arm an a gheur ghaobhan
Nuair chunnaig iad Goll cro
Doll an uacar air Conn treun-chro-ach
Conan ga leigeadh a' cas cruaicruaidh
An deigh a lon thoirt a mhithcairt
SeacSeachd bliannabliadhna do Gholl an aigh
Ga leubhas gu rorobh e slan o thus
Seinn cuil sa pronnadh oir
Fo throma dhaibh
Mise s dorust fosgail
Bheir

div.p:
Bran mac Buidheig agus For mac
Leig da chu b fearrb fhearr bha riamh san Fheinn
Buidheag mathair Bhran agsu Leig mathair
Fòrr.

She – Catrina MacCuithein – heard these
things from her uncle Ruarai ruadh
mac Cuithein who lived at Scolpaig.
He was a catechist and used to go about
from house to house. He had eighteen
books written about the Feinne which his
son who turned a F.CFree Church burnt.

lg.l: Cold blows the wind through the chinks in the window
High roll the waves along from the sea
While I lie here cold lonely & weary
Far far away Mary dear Mary from thee.
When lonely I strayed throthrough the darkness of night
Thou wert the ligth that illuminated my way
When feebly I groped for the path of the right
Thou wert the staff that supported my stay

div.p:
Aireamh Sir D Muintir Dhubhain
leis an Catrina ciadna. OctOctober 5, 1865

Thainig fios a' Lochlan a dh-ionn
suidh na Feinne dol a Lochlan
thun banais dha'n na Chro Phriomh
-bhan (Priomh-lhan) Thaine muic
bait orra agus dh-iarr Diarmad
air Fionn a lamh a chuir fo dheud
fios fiach an rorobh tearnadh s am bith
aca ri fhaotainn. Dh-fiosraichDh-fhiosraich fios
agus fior eolas e gun e an dala
buidhean a bhathadh agus gum
faigheadh a bhuidhean eile gu tir
Thuirt nighean Dhubhain an uair
sin gun cuireadh ise nan suidhe
iad agus gun aireamh i rist rithistiad
Rinn i sin.

lg.l: CeararCeathrar o Fhionn dar dhuine air [supralinear: thus
Le 'n coigear dhugha nan dail
A dhearbh mhuinntir Dhubhain
Dithis o Mac Cumhail a shnuagh
Fear o Dhubhan dreathach ruadh
Triuir o Mhac Cumhail is ailliaillidh dreach
Fear o Dhubhan till a mach
Cha suidh Fionn anns a bhruth bhan
Gun dithis dhugh air a laimh
S gun dithis eile nan deigh
A chindeac Fhinn a Alba
Dithis dhugh ma Dhubhan til
Aon fhear Fionn nam fochai sidsiod
Da laochraidh dhugha nan dail
Dithis o Fhionn s fear o Dhubhan.
'S cha b' uillir dhuinn fear eile.

div.p:
– nam biodh cha chuireadh i
h-athair ann. S Chuir nighean
Dhubhain na aoine nan crothai
air bial a bhata agus a chuile
naoi bha i cunnteadh dha i cuir

Thainig i sin gu h-athair agus
rug e air agus thilg e mach e agus
thuirt i "Bithidh gach dileas gu

faclan an toiseach. 'S iad teaghlach
Dhubhain agus teaghlach Fhinn
a b' ainmeile bha s an Fh Eirinn.
Bha nighean dh-an gaol air Feinn
Cha do phos eile an deigh a chuile
car a bh' ann eagal gun gabhadh
i gaol air fear eile agus gun dean
adh i sgam air easan e fhein a
chuir gu bas mar a chuir e h-
athair.

There is a man at Baghasdal
who has the story – John Smith
He was building for the Policeman
at Lochmaddy. i.e. Sgeul
Choise Cèin. Got the tale from Patruig
Smith whose son was building the police
man's house mentioned.

Laoidh Cairagain mhoir mhic
Righ Lochlain. Le Eachan Mac
Isaig Ceannlangabhat OctOctober 6th 1865
div.title: Deilbh na sgeul
div.p:
Se sin an fhagail bha aig an Fhinn
nuair bhiodh iad fad an t-samhraidh
thall ann an Eirinn a sealg. Bha
coigeamh do dh EEirinn aca bho righ
Eirinn airson seilge. Bha an Righ
a toirt sin dhaibh airson frith-
aladh dha fhein nuair bhiodh
feum aig[e] orra an am cogaidh.

Bha iad a tighinn do dh-Alba an
am a gheamhraidh. Bha e
na chleachadh aig Fionn Righ
Righ na Feinne cuilm a
thoirt seachad a chuile [deleted: n] la
Nollaig do'n a chuile duine TransTranscribed Book III
12 NovNovember 1869 A.Alexander A.ArchibaldC.Carmichael
bha san Fhinn firionn us
boirionn oga us sean. Nis
nuair a chruinnich an sluagh
a chum na cuilm bha distdithist
ann a bha suil-seirc nan aod-
an – Ailse – greannach an
fhuilt dheirg agus Mororan.
Bha eagal air Fionn gun ga
adh ann athair chacha gaol
orra orra agus chuir e air
leth bho'n chuilm iad. Cha
be mhain gun ghabhadh na
ni h-oighean oga gaol orra ach
na mnathan posda. Cha do-
dh-innis Fionn daibh carson
a chuir e air leth iad agus ghabh
na laoich tamailte mhor agus
san a thog iad orra gu Righ
Lochlan. Be Righ Lochlan h athair
mathair Fhinn agus ged be
bhiodh iad daonnan a cogadh.
Bhiodh Righ Lochlan a tagar air
Fionn agus a tighinn an
conuidhcomhuidh le luingis a thoirt sgrios
air an Fheinn. Rainig a sin Ailte
agus Mororan Righ Lochlain agus
thuirt iad ris gun tainig iad an
ann aige. Se seo ni bu toillite le
RRigh LLcchlain a chual e riamh agus bha e
toilleach aont choig bhlianna ach
cha ghabhadh iadsan ach aont aon
bhlianna. Ghabh iad so. Bha iad cho
muirneach aig RRigh LLochlain agus nuair
bhiodh am feacfeachd a choir tur an
righ nach fonadhfoghnadh s nach fiu ach
ar bhi aig cuirm s aig cuideaccuideachd
ach cocomhla ris an Righ fhein.
Phos a sin Earragan mor
mac Righ LLochlain ng nighean Righ
na Fraing. Cha rorobh e posd ach
sia seacuinean nuair a ghabh
e gaol a cricridhe air Ailbe agus
cha deanadh e tamh na fois
gus an teicheadh e lealeithe gus an
Fheinn. Dh innis Ailbe so do
Mhoraran agus thuirt MorMoraran
ris gum be seo ni g bu chorchoir
a dheanadh – nach cual a
Fionn ni riamh a b fhearr
leis an bhean a thoirt bho
Mhororan – mac bhrathair
a mhathar fhein. Cha ghabh
adh e ta aig Aible gum bu toill
le Fionn an gniomh so idir
ach co dhiu theich iad. RainRainig
an triur an Fheinn gus fhuair
iad lamhan sgaoilte rompa.
Cha rorobh fada gus an d' iondran
eadh na an da ghaisgeach
Ailbe agus Moronan air falbh
agus og-bhean Earragain mhoir.
Chuir Earragan mor a sin fios
thun na Fhinn gun sgrios
adh e an Fheinn agus Alba
airson mar a rinn iad air B
Tionnaidh mi Alba bun os cion
agus bheir mi sgrios air an deigh
an Fheinn a mharbhadh as.
Thuirt Ailse agus MorMoraran ris an Righ
nuair a bhiodh a bhliannabhliadhna mach gum
faicheadh iad an gabhadh iad coig bliannabliadhna
eile.

Aile nighean righ Chunancaigh
Aile dean thusa rium baigh
S na h-innis i uile bhrach
Dh imirch e sgiathan gu Dun tuili
S nach do dh-imrich te riamh e roimpe
Gun thog i lea mo sgiath
Dh imich i lea gu dianaidh
Cha lubadh i gas fo cois
S idir cha lotadh i foirnein
LaLatha dhan FhFhein am BBeinn ionaiionaigh
Gair nan cath eir tulach shamhna
Os mo chionnsa
Guil nam bair eir faich na h-amhna
Am beula(?) liumsa
Mnathun tulach leaba chorrach
Sgarbh an sgleo thig anm dheoigh
Thig trom orra – sgarbh an sgleo

div.p:
From Hector Macleoid (Eachunn
mac Alastair) cottar IocarIochdar 29 SepSeptember 1872
I don't understand these lines. AAlexander A.Archibald C.Carmichael

Bogha Liur on west side of Vallay – when Lir
mac Righ Righ LochlanLochlan's ship struck and
drowned her owner. Read this Lir aught
to with Lir the father of Mannan?

div.title: ToiriocToiriochd Na TaineacTaineachd
div.p:
EachEachann Macleod ("EachEachann mac
Ruari) Ceanntangabhal
La-fheill-Moire 15th AugAugust 1873

ChunngChunnaig e n taitaigh na chraoslacchraoslach
chraobhach sholuist.
Oriol fhaolamich

"Chan dhan Fhinn air Tulach Oiril
Bhuillaisteach. "ThoisThoisich cumhan
teallaich ac mun dhruim am tarn
ichean." "Mar faughte dheoin
e bheairte dh aineion ars ise
an tara." "Saillichion , = steadings

Fearghas Phillistanach & athair
S ad gun scot aca fhein leis an
daoraich. Chan fhan uthu air son
feich na tobhartas an tarbh.
"Shaor e na riamh" an an dobhar chu
Ball]=doran dobhrain.

"Gach toirioctoiriochd gu toractorachd na Taine
gach each-drain gu each-drain
Mhanus gach duan gu duan
an Deirg s gach laoilaoidh gu laoilaoidh
an Amadain Mhoir."
div.title: Deilbh agus aoraobhar na sgeuil
div.p:
Bha duin uasal ann EiriEirinn ris
an canadh ad an Du altach
Cha bu tiearnatighearna fearfearainn idir e ach
bha cuid mhor an t saoghail aige
s bha insionnsachadh math aige s leis a sin
bha aite suisuidhe aig an cuideacuideachd
uislean. Bha e fhein agus Iarla
Ghlinn-chuilisg colacomhla anns a
cholaiste & bha adiad nam caidcairdean
nan compcompanaich. Cha rorobh air an Du
do theolachteoghlach an ghille mhir. BhBha
nieannighean an Iarla posposadh & chuir an
an t Iarla cuircuireadh chun na bainnse
dh iondh ionnsuidh an DualDuallaich seacseachduinn roiroimhe n am
Dh falbhDh fhalbh an DulDuallach & a bhean chun
na bainnse le'n gillean s le eich
dhiolta. Bha CuCuchullain a sirsireadh falfalbh cocomhla ris
s cha leigte ris. Nuair a dh falbhdh fhalbh
adsan dh falbhdh fhalbh easeasan as an deoideoghaidh
Bha ball us caman aig g iomag iomain fad
an an lalatha san rarathad aid as an deoideoghaidh.
am bial na h-oicheh-oidhche an dol fofodha
na greine rainig adiad na drochdrochaid mhor
bha dol thun pa pelios an Iarla.
Bha cu air an drochdrochaid ga cur
gleigleidheadh s cha leigleigeadh duine sachseachad
gun pheigh. Cha rorobh airgairgead aig
a ghille. SmaoinSmaointich e aigaige fhein
gum bu tamtamailteach dha tilltilleadh dhachdhachaidh
agus chuir e am baill eir sorach
an & bhuail e staistaigh eir an dala
ceann sa mach air a cheann
eileile e s chuir e n cu na bhuta
leis an drochdrochaid. Sin a chiad
euceuchd a rinn CCuchullain.

GhaGhabh e staistaigh an bhaile s chunchunnaic e gilgillean
ag iomiomain & thoisthoisich e air iomiomain cocomhla riuriutha
gus an tainig an oichoidhche. Duair thainig
an oichoidhche thuirt e ri fear dha na
gillegillean Nach ann ors easeasan anns
a bhaile seo tha taitaigh an Iarla
Sann ors an gille eile De do ghno
aichgnothaich sa ris? Nach eil beanis beanais
mhor ann. Tha & B fhearr liom
gun ionsionnsuiche tu dhodhomh e. Cha leig ad
is taitaigh uthu. Tha m' a'airathair eir a
bheanais & fiachfiachaidh mi an leigleigeil
Bha an caistcaisteil eir a laslasadh le craoscraoslach
craobhcraobhlach sholuist. GhaGhabh e staistaigh is
ghaghabh e miosg na cuidcuideachd s thug riuriuth
a null s chaichaidh e eadeadar da chois
athair. An du tha se ors airathair
S mi ors CuCuchullain CiamCiamar fhuair
uthu staistaigh san cu air an drochdrochaid
MharMharbh mi [a]nan cu De'art bha
ach fear do stiubhartan an
Iarla san rum & falbhfalbhar & insinnsear ga mhaismhaighstir bha ChuChuchullain
Leum an t Iarla nuas. Co tha seo
ors easeasan a mharmharbh mo chu
Cha tuirt duine diog. Bha
eageagal orra. Thuirt an DualDualtach Seo
e ors easeasan tha gag rathrathain rium
a mharmharbh do b chu. Cha creid
mi sin gum marmarbhadh an gille
beag sin mo rudruda O s mi mhmharbh
e gu dearbh s cha chuir gu
duine sam bibith e ach mise
Bhuil ors an t Iarla feumfeumaidh tu
fuirfuireach 7 bliannabliadhna air drochdrochaid air ach
choin gus an tog mismise an cu
ni t aitaite a phéphéidh dhomh £700
SasSasannach. An ta pepeidh mise sin ors
DuDualtach & cha mhor is fhiach mi
fhefhein na dhedheoigh. Ach nam faighfaighinn
uine pheinn e s mi fhefhein bhi
mar bha mi roiroimhe. Cha phaiphaigh
Dh eirich easeasan a sin na sheassheasamh
ucha phaigh thu aon sgilsgillin ach theid mise
chun na drochdrochaid gg ga gleigleidheadh
cearstas a choin a chumchumail riumsriumsa.
Bha e sin blianbliadhna air an drochdrochaid
Bha e fuasfuathasach eir son sgoil & a chuile
duine thigthigeadh chun na drochdrochaid theirtheireadh
Cha leig mi null thu mar toir
uthu dhomh leasan & dar thigthigeadh
duin uasal an radrathad bheirbheireadh e dha
leasleasan & paipaigheadh cois. ThaigThainig e sin
dachdachaidh. Bha anns an am sin
dhan t-saolt-saoghal colaiste ann
an Dun-sgàthaich anns
an EilEilean Sgith-anachSgitheanach agus cha
rorobh fear ris am b fhiach fear
a rarath an rioghrioghachd na h-Alba na
h EirEirinn no ShasShasunn nanach cuircuireadh a
mhac ann ga ionsionnsachadh. Cha rorobh
meas air fear ach fear
a gheogheobhadh ionionnsuchadh an Dun SgathSgathaich
cha bhiod Cha rorobh sgoil no cleas
faolfaolum droch cleaschleas no cleas
mamath nach faightfaighte sin. s cha
rorobh meas eir cleas ach cleas
a gheobhgheobhadh ann. Cha bhiobhiodh CCuchullain
beo mar leigtleighte air falfalbh do Dhun
SgathSgathaich e & leigleigeadh air ann e. Bha e
9 blianbliadhna ann a sin. Bha uasuasal
(see lay frfrom[om] Padra Buidhe
Port Charlotte on this)
a sin san am chiad fear
ris an abairte Aon Fear
diag mac Daimhain mac
do dh uasal Albanach. Bha
adiad 9 blibliadhna a lailaigh sa g eireirigh ann
broilbroileach a cheile nan compcompanaich
N am bha i a dealdealachadh mhionmhionnaich
adiad ga cheile nach cuircuireadh a
h-aon aca triobtrioblaid
chuile gu brach ach gun
eireirich adiad le cheile. Cha ro[bh] sian
a dh-iondh-ionnsuich an dala fear nach
dh-iondh-ionnsuich am fear eile ach
aon chleas a bh aig CCuchullain ris an caintcainte
an 'gath-balg'. Dh fagDh fhag adiad Dun
SgSgathaich & dhealdhealaich adiad ri cheile & thill
CulCuchulain dhachdhachaidh do dh EiriEirinn. Bha
gillean acha & b iad an da bhrathr
ean Gille na h Iuraich aig an
Fhear Dheag & Laochaire mac
Nearst aig CulChuchulain. Bha aca
nam page san sgoil & bha
adiad fhein ionionnsuichte gu leor Lean
Laochaire mac Nearst
CulCuchulain a dh-Eirdh-Eirinn.

Bha 50 agh aig an DuDualtaich ann
eilean mara & de ach a rug fear
dhan laogh & cha rorobh fios fo thalathalmh[mh]
na criosdacciosdachd caite an d fuaird fhuair
e taratarbh. Cha rorobh dath bha ann
am bogh frois no an iarmailt
no ann an coille-blianain
ma na mara nach so eir an laogh.
Cha bhibhiodh CCuchulain beo 's e na gil ghille taptapaidh
an deideigh tinntighinn far na drochdrochaid far mus
faifaigh e nan laogh. Cha rorobh airathair deondeonach
an laogh thoirt dha bho nach bu
bhoirbiorionn e. FeumFeumaidh mi fhaifhaighinn – s fhearr
lioms am fiorfiorionn seo no deich bhoirbhoirionn
& fhuair e 'n laogh. Dh fasDh fhas an laogh
gus nach rorobh leidleithid an EEirinn ach ach e fhefhein
Bha e san each-draieach-draidh ach an
dia cha mhumhotha tha ta mi fhefhein
ga lean chuid a MhrMhaighstir AlastAlastair
gun cuircuireadh e mart eir dhar
le geum an an coig ChoigChoigeam na h EirEirinn.
B e 'n Donn guailionn a b ainm
da. ThaiThainig CulCuchulain dachdachaidh agus bhiobhiodh e
fhein sa ghille fala a shealg gu
taotaobh eile na h EirEirinn Bha e taoltaoghol eir
nieannighean a ghara mac Stairn
& theirtheireadh e ririthe thig mi nan diudiugh
'S thig mi mairmaireach s dhiandhianadh e coincoinneamh
ri[rithethe] s e bun a bhann theichruith i leis.
Thug e dhachdhachaidh i gu taitaigh airathair & bha
e eir taitaigh dha fhein.

Bu bharinbharuinn eir dala le EEirinn san
am boirboirionnach ris an caintcainte Maoim
a Chruachain & bu righ eir an
leleth eile Oirreal Fhaolumach
Bha 'adiad nam bantraichean le
cheile Bhuail an cairdcairdean an
comhcomhairleichean dha gum b' fhearr dhaidhaibh
posposadh & cuide a chur ri cheile.
Bha fear ionionad righ aicese mac
peathar dhi feaghusfearghus Phil
isteach – Se bu chomhairliche
aicaice. Am bi deochdeonach mise phosphosadh
OirlOiriol. BiBithidh mismise orsorsa FFearghus gus an
t ualuallach a leigleigeil dhiom fhein
Phos adiad. ChuirChuireadh gu posposadh adiad
An ceann mios norud
iginrudeiginchaidchaidh aidiad gu
butar 's cionn – throid adiad.
Bhuail an dala h aon eir
cuir a dh ailis eir an t aon
eile gugun rorobh barracbarrachd aig eir an
chuid an t-saolt-saoghail. ThoisThoisicheadhadiad
a seo eir cuntcunntas an stuic & bha
tarabh aigsan a bharracbharrrachd
oirise – Am Binne-bheo'ach
Bhuail ise sin eir feorfeoraich a
dh-Fheadh-Fhearghus cait am faighfaighte taratarbh
a gha'adhghabhadh eir a BhinBhinn-bheoch sa gheogheobhadh
buaibuaidh eir s nach bi beo shaolshaoghail
aice mar faighfaigheadh. Cha'n aineaithne dhomh
sin ors fearfearghus cait am faighfaighear n
ach taratarbh bheag CuCuchullainDualtach ris an caintcainte
DonDonn-guaillionn & cha ne furastfurasta fhaifhaighinn
uaiuaithe. Tha e fhein laidir s tha
mhac ro ladlaidir moralach
s mar faifaighear le sisith e chan fhafhaighear
idir le feirg e. Cha'n eil duinduine
agam gan fhearr thig a chuis
chur an ceil na sibh fhein. ThidTheid
sibh a shirshireadh an tairtairbh & bheir sibh
leibh 13 gha na gillean mora
Rainig adiad air a mheanmheadhan lalatha
ChaiChaidh FFearghus eir taitaigh ShirShireadh e'n taitaigh
as a sheassheasamh Tha chabhag ort –
nan'n ann a sirsireadh teine thaithainig uthu? Dean
suisuidhe. Cha dean gus am faifaigh
mi fios mo ghnouichghnothuich. An
ta chan an agagamsa tha sin ri
thoirt dhut ach aig mo mhac
CuCuchulain. Tha e 'sa bheinn sheilg ach
bi e dhachdhachaidh am bial an ana
moich. Se do bheabheatha fhein co
rium fhefhein nocnochd & fuirfuirich gus an
tig CuCuchulain. Tha gilgillean mormora agam a
thug mi liom & cha'n eil e freagfreagarrach
adiad a bhi co ruinn. Tha saillean
gu leoir agamsa san cuir
a suas adiad. ChuirChuireadh biabiadh us
deoch thun nan gilgillean mora
& ghaghabh adiad an dall daorach
gus nach rorobh smuirgeadh aca
Bha FFearghus &' DDualtach ag ol san taitaigh mhor
gus an taigtainig dachdachaidh am bial na h oicheoidhche.
ChualChuala e beum mhor san t saolsabhal
aig airathair s ghaghabh e null. ThaigThainig e
sin an taitaigh aig airathair mhor Sin
fear do ghnoghnothach ors airDulDualtach ri
FearFearghus. ThoisThoisich a sin FFearghus an sin
eir sirsireadh an tairbh cho milist
s cho seolta s cho briarachbriathrach sa
b urra dha – gheogheobh uthu ars easeasan do
dhor do airgairgead agus caidcairdeas na
Maoim ChrChrachain &c. Cha tuirt CCuchullain guguth
ach ag eisdeisdeachd ris. ThionThionndaidh e chulchulaobh
Am faifaigh mi an tartarbh? Chan eil
fios nach faifaigh. Ghrad dh eirdh eirich
FearFearghus a mach & thug e an soalsothal
eir far an rorobh na gilgillean mormora
Lean CuCuchullain e. Bha adiad dall
leis an daordaoraich. An d fhuair
uthu 'n tartarbh? ors a chuile fear riris.
fhuair mi ach chan fhaifhaigheadh
mo ghilghillean e. Am fear seo sam
fear ad eile car son nach faifaigheadh
do ghilghillean e. Mar faighfaigheadh adiad a g dheon
e bheirbheireadh adiad a dh aindh aineoin e. ChualChuala
CCuchullain seo mar a thill FearFearghus air ais
dhan bhad as a' falbh e chuir
e gad air an dorust los nach
faifaigheadh duine mach agus chuir
e 'n taitaigh na theine 's loisg e man
ceann e. Sann san aon rum
a chadchaidil FFearghus & an DulDuallach. Bha adiad fadfada
gun chadchadal ach a seanseanchas – duinduine
thall s duine bhos. Nuair a
thainig CCuchullain is taitaigh sa mhadmhaduinn sa
thog FeFearghus a cheancheann chunchunnaig e CCuchuallain
Seadh bheil sisibh bra bhibhith cho
mamath sar gealgealltanus an diudiugh Tha
gu dearbdearbh gu deart gheall
mi? Nach do gheall sisibh
dhomh an tartarbh? Gu de an
gealtangealtanus a rinn mi – an tuirt
mi riut ach dh fhaodte
gu faighfaigheadh & tha fios agam
an diugh nach fhaigh uthu e.
Nan tuga tusa leat cuidcuideachda mhogh
ail dh fhaodte gu faitefaighte tu leat
e. ChaiChaidh FFearghus a mach agus se bu
sheall maidsheallamaid dha cna'uncnamhan nan
daoine aig eir ghoil nan gual
loisgeloisgte. ChaiChaidh e dhachdhachaidh. Dh fheDh fheoraich
a bhean dha an t fhuair uthu nan tartarbh
Cha d fuaird fhuair s cha do chuir tu cucuideachd
bu mhumhutha eir falfalbh chan fhaifhaigheadh
adiad an tartarbh. Bhòinnicheadh a
sin air a Bharuin e eir Oiril dol
cocomhla a nist an ceann mios &
& throd adiad a ristrithist 'sa ristrithist s bha
daondaonnan Am Binne BheoachBheothach (Horned
Caora bhinneach or bheannach 4 oor 5 oor 6
horned sheep now rare in Uist).
Chuir a sin a Maoim litrlitrichion mach thun
urra mor EEirinn ShasShasunn & Ab.Alba. Fear sam
bith a thig thoirt mach an DonnDonn-ghuaillinn gum
faifaigh air cairdeas leighis na MaoiMaoim
CChruachain & lamh dheas Oirrill (herself to many
& Oriel's place) SeanSeanchaidh) Bha i na sean
chailchaillich ghranda ghlas s cha rorobh ann
am fear a phosphosadh i gad bheirbheireadh i EirEirinn
uile dha. Chuir a sin boirboirionnach bha
mun cuairt di fhein na ceann
litir chuir thun an Fhirdiag.
Rinn i sin ach cha b ann gu
posposadh no dad ach gu cuilm mhor
bha i gos thoirt seachseachad. Bha brainbrathairean
an Fhir Diag a muigh aig a bhuin
& bha am FFeardiag na shuishuidhe eir carn faisg
orra s gun e diandianadh dad nuair
thainig litlitir MMaoim Chruachain thuige. Leugh
e 'n litir. Tha litir a seo ors easeasan
ra bhrabhrathairean a thainig thugthugam o MhMhaoim
CCruachain a sin orm titighinn chun cuilm
Chuala sinn ma na litir
sin roiroimhe Litir tintighinn gad iarriarraidh fos
a posposadh ors a bhrathbrathair se tartarruinn as
Gu deart tha uthu gragrath! Ne mise
phosphosadh an t seann scraoirt
chailchaillich! Ach gun teagteagamh sam bith
feumfeumaidh mi dol agus a Bharuinn
a fhreagairst s an chuir e fios
orm. NarNuair a thaigthainig e thoisthoisich ol us
ceol us danndannsa us gaidgairdeachas us greangreannachas mor
Bha Le Fear Diag. fear a b' annsa
bha san tri rioghrioghachdan – sann dha
na Fir mhora bha e & san
dha na Fir bheaga bha Cul
Chuir Maoim Chruachain a cheist ri FearFeardiag
de is lagha ghaasghabhas tu agus
dol a ghleic ri CCuchullain eir faiche
choraig aig 12 mairmaireach? A righ
a fhir sid ann an cuircuireadh rud
ma choinchionneamh rud a dhian
nach urra mi – Ne mise reachreachainn
a ghleic ri CCuchullain! An e fear bha
lalaidhe sa g eiridh nam bhrollach fad nan
naogh blibliadhna & gur docha liom e na
gin gam bhrabhraithrean Mise dhol a gleic
ri CCuchullain! ReachReachainn a ghleghleic ri fear a reareachainn
a ghleacghleaceadh ris agus is mise nach
fear san bi thu na namh aig
CCuchullain cha chuirchuirinn eir eirson duine
sam bibith. ThoisThoisich a sin an t ol
& chuirchuireadh an dall daordaorach eir FFeardiag
agus thuirt e far an rorobh e. Cha rorobh do
chridhe ann pagpage MMaoim Chruachain na
thogthogadh as a siod e & se bhoirbhoirionnach
thug cuirigean thairis air ann
far an rorobh e. SgriSgriobh ise (MMaoim Chruchain) litir
fhoilleil mhosmhosach an ainm
FFeardiag a ghealghealladh gun reachreachadh e ghleac
CCuchullain & chuir i siod na phoca
Aig a bhraiceas an lair
na mhairmhaireach thuirt i Seadh AlbAlbannaich
mhath bheil uthu deas deondeonach
do ghealghealladh a chumail dhomh
an diugh – dol a ghleac CuCuchullain
san DonnDonn-guaillion thoirt thugamsa? Ne
mise reacreachadh a ghleac CuCuchullain – mo
chaomh chairdcairdean fhein – fear
mo bhrolbhrollaich s mo bhraghaid bha g eireiridh
sa lailaighe co rium fad nan 9 blbliadhna - bu
gh chruaichruaidh bhiodh a chuis orm duair
nach reachreachainn a gleac ri fear a
ghleacghleacadh ris. Mas ann eir son seo
thug uthu cuircuireadh cuilm dhomh
chan eil mi d chomain. Seall
eir an litir nad phoca & eir a ghealghealladh
a thug uthu dhomh. Sheall e. Chrath
e cheann & chrom e cheann
gu lar & shillshilleadh a dheoir gu
frasach trom. Mar dhuine &
mar ghaisgghisgeach cha tigtigeadh e 'n cois
fhacail & grisgriobh e litir thun
CCuchullain coincoinneachadh a chumchumail ris eir FFaiche choraig
air 12 mairmaireach. DirDireach doirduoir bha falbh
air bheinn sheilg choinchoinnich gillgille aig
an dorust e a shin dha litir.
Seadh, seadh bheil fios agsaagadsa a LLaochaire de n litlitir
a fhuair mise seo. Dh inns e Dh
Cha'n aona ghnoghnothach ceart a thaithainig rium
Theid s diochuindhiochuin 's docha nach
deach e bhrist air na mionmionnan a thug
e. Tha mi 'n dochas nach deadeach
ach gu de thug dha fios chun
thug a choinchoinneamh air FFearghus chor an
aite tinntighinn ann choid cho lualuath
sa bhuail a chas FiarFiardiag EirEirinn.
ChoinChoinnich adiad a cheile & chuir
adiad failte us furfuran us phog
adiad a cheile. Bha adiad a sin a
sp spaidspaidsearachd a sios sa suas
ann an cairdcairdean mar bha
adiad riariamh. Gu de na cleasan
ris am bi sinsinn an diudiugh
orsorsa FFeardiag. Cleas sam bibith thogthogras
sisibh fhein? Na bi sinn a
caitheamh na sleaghsleagha ann
an cul an earra. Thug adiad treis
mar sin. Thuirt FFeardiag riut coma
liom dhan doidoigh leibidich shuashuarach
sin chloinne bige – gamdgabhamaid
an t seann doidoigh cheart Taing
a Ni-math orsorsa CCuchullain gur tustusa bhrist
eir na mionmionnan s nach mise. Lean
an ruig a seo eir CCuchullain gus na chuircuireadh
a mach air an taotaobh eile dh-
Fhaich choraig. NanNann brabrath am
bas leigleigeil thugthugamsa a tha uthu orsorsa CCuchuallain ri Loar
Laochaire Mac NNeart Ruith LLaochaire
agus chuir e stad eir am bhial-ath. Thill
CCuchullain an toractorachd eir FFeardiag. Dh' eubh FFeardiag
eir gille na h-Iuraich a leigleigeil
dhan bhial ath & leig e ruith
dha Leum a sin Laochaire
& rug eir a bhrabhrathair & sparsparr e
taruntarunn na chluais ri craibhcraoibh
Spion GGille na h-Iuraich a chraoibh as a friamh
agus leig e ruith dhan bhial
ath. Leum LLaochaire & rug eir a bhrabhrathair
agus spion e 'n ceann as an
amhuich aige & stad e am

Rinn e sin GGarbh a ristrithist & chuir CCuchullain
a ghlaic ri cul a chinn thug e
sios leis an chreig. Dh falbhDh fhalbh e sin
gu dol dhachdhachaidh & dhach lorg mhor
mhor ris anns ghleann – lorg
duine & lorg bruit. Bha fhad
& a liadliathad fhein ann an lorglorgan

bruid chan eil fios gu de
mheudmheudachd bha 'n lorg an tairbh.
Lean e gu da lorg mhor

busbu 's ciall daidaibh. Dor bhal e dol

shios & tarbh eir a' roic aige
Smeid an duinduine eir agus
dh eudh eubh e ris. Bha eageagal eir CCuchullain dol
na choir & chaichaidh e far an roghrobh e.
aig taotaobh a bhaigh. SiudSiuthad cuidcuidich
mise ors am fear mor. Cha
chuidchuidich mismise gus an cluinn mi
desde 's aobhar dhuit mo chuidchuideachadh
iarriarraidh. InInnsidh mi sin duit Tha
mi o chionchionn 7 blbliadhna toirt toraic na
taine bho m bhrabhrathair ach mun
tar mi dhol na dail bi
easeasan agagam & tha e ga toirt uam
Ach cuidcuidich usathusa mi & bi ri agagainn
eir a marmarbh mun tig e agus
tha cruach mhoin ann
siod agus bruich sinn i & bi
sinn nas treastreasa gu cath chur
an deideigh an taratarbh ichichidh. ThaingThainig
easeasan mun do shartharr adiad ach pairt
dhen tara ich. Tha mam fear seo
tintighinn orsorsa am fear mor. Bha
chraos fosgailte s dhiandhianadh a chricridhe
sa ghrianan solust ro bhial.
Sheas e eir taotaobh thall a bhaibhaigh & shin
an da bhrabhrathair eir caicaitheadh nan sleagh
eir a cheilcheile. Shin CCuchullain eir cuidcuideachadh
an fhir mor bha eir a thaothaobh fhein
ach cha chuir e shaishaighead treasa
trian dha'n astar. ChaiChaidh e ma
chuairt a bhaibhaigh & thoisthoisich ri doch
an fhir mhor (ReachReachadh e staistaigh fo
gho'al) an cul nam bailc. Bha
am fear mor a faireachain tachas an
cul a chas agus thug e suil
& bhuail e breab o thaothaobh a chuil
ga thoirt fhein a aoric an tairtairbh bha e ri linn dha 'n claidhclaidheamh
bhrist. Chuir an gogobha mach na
daoine. Dh falDh fhalaich ninnighean mhor
mhungach ruaruadh leis a ghoghobha i
fhein fo'n bhalg. Doir a dh inndh innis

nad ChuChuchullain a bha ]uthu nar sin

Le teas na h-obraich thug e
chlogchlogad far a chinn agus legleag e
ri thaothaobh e. ThionThionndaidh MMaoim a Chruachain a sin gu
gnua ri FFeannag ninnighean a ChalChaladair NanNann
a brabrath mo chuid airm a leigleigeil
gu bas gu chuile tha uthu an
deideigh duais mhor a ghailghabhail uam.
Ghrad leum FeanFeannag an riocriochd
feanfeannaig anns san speur & thaigthainig
e nall bhuail i eir seolseoladh os
a chionn san adhar. Cha do
chuir easeasan diu dhi shaoil
leis gun feanfeannag ghrandaghrannda ghlas
i. Leig i sios mionach
glaisein lan puisein eir
a cheann ruistruisgte. LaoiLaoidh sidsiod eir
an e ionachainionnachain aigesaaigesan Tha
mo neart smo fhrarcfhradharc am
threisginn a dheo LLaochaire cait bheil
uthu? Rid thaothaobh. Cuir clach am
laimh fiach gu de 'n euceuchd a ni
mi. Shad e chlach. De feum
a ni mi lesleis a siod? Mharbh
Bhuail a an dobhar. Cuir
mo chul ris an sgala s mo
fhraa. Am faca uthu ca na bhuail
a chlach. Bhuail ann cul
a chinn eir an dobhar chu & eir
strabh na fala air an ath. An
do mharamharbh mi e? O mharbh –
chan eil sgrid anann – shaor e
na raimh. Tha sin g ininnseadh gu
bheil am bas agamsa. Bha e
san dailgneacdailgneachd (prophecy)
gur h-e sin a chiad euceuchd san
t euceuchd mu dheidheireadh a dhiandhianainn
sa cu mharmharbhadh. Ach cuir tog usathusa
mo an claidhclaidheamh mor eir mo ghuaghualainn
& cuir an t sleagh mhor for
m ucuchd. SaoilSaoilidh adiad gum bi ad mi
beo & cha tig adiad a null eir an
aath. SinSinidh ustusa mach far bheil Goll
brarbrathair mo mhamhathar & inninnsidh dha mar
thachthachair &c RaingRainig eir an Fhinn
– bha adiad an EEirinn san am. A shron
a sna adh sa gha droma
Deart an saolsaoghal sin th aig ris
An am bhi dol seachseachad eir
coille & bhuain e tri ghadan
seo cuir sin gu s an lion
mismise adiad leis na cinn bu doch
lesleis fhein bhi eir ghad. 3 times
he let the withy go. ThaingThainig
te dhius a nall & bhuail i eir
seolseoladh os a chionn s Bha i tintighinn
na bu daine s na bu daine mar
bhios na feanfeanagun grandgrannda an comcomhuich
S dearbh a ghniomh MhiMhic AlAlasdair. cha bu chai
lion fhin na fian si gaged nanach
bibiodh ann ach siod fhein.) gus
na shuishuidhe eir a ghualghualainn.
Tha nan t suil eir dundunadh san
bial ad eir preas grodadh s faodfaodaidh lucluchd
nan cleas tintighinn a nall.
Ma bhios ceanceann a dhi nan a dhi nan
tri ghadghadan feumfeumaidh do cheancheann
sa mo no do cheancheann dol ann
S cintcinnteach gun rorobh ceann le
air thusthusa ann. Thog CCuchullain & dh-
amhlaiceadh e. Tha 'n sgial
a mach.

Heard this from Ruary ruaruadh MaMac
Cuidhein. Bha sa cheistcheistear NNorth[orth] UUist. He
died 50 yrsyears ago. I heard this when I
was abtabout 15 or 16 when I heard him.
He was a catecatechist going about
among the people. But the lays
of OsOssian & the old stories of the Fian
were his principal themes.

Coinneach MacFhasgail, Caolas Scalpay
13 SeptSeptember 1873

lg.l: S olc a theirig tusa bhuamsa
AairAthair uasail anameinich
An t sleagh an coinecoinneamh a h-earlinearlainn
Seall a nis is mi gun fhracradh
Co mhiar mu bheil am faine

div.p:
Cuchullain left Aodan Ban Skye
& left a bean tortorach & when the sliocsliochd Con
laich was 18 he went in search of
his father (Chuile duinduine b fho'intichfhoghaintich
na cheile san dhan Fheinn bha 'ad
dol) An lorg-chroiseach agus
a nodan-cnamh. The nodan cnacnamh
was on the head of the long-chrios to guard
him frfrom the sleagh. He had 2 spears each
man. This nodan was open & hued
with brasssbrass copper or iron.

NieanNighean an Laobhaire was ran
away with CuchCuchullain & was his wife. When will
I get my dinner said her brobrother who came
to see her & who was bitbitter. Look for the
cows. He did so. Cait a bheil mo
dhinter said he to the herdherdsman Bheir
mi liom an taratarbh. CautCaught it & tore it & each
had half for his dindinner. Se nighean
Bhalcan gobha chuir puisean
air ceann CuCuchullain air an drochaid
bhain an Lochaber. Bha e sin
5 yrsyears an deideidh a bhais na sheasamh
s cha tig aon do an Sasunaich
is taigh air a sraid leis an eagal
roi s cad an anil gun rorobh e beo.

800 yrsyears since Macleod came to Skye.
When Olaghaire son of RiRigh LochlanLochlain
came pleasuring was wrecked at Poll
til & put up in a place Carn-garbh till
morning. then went on to Dun veagain.

lg.l: Sir TormTormod[od] mo ruin
A shliocsliochd Ollagair a chu
S gun b ainmeal o thus t abhaist
Tha uthu shliocshliochd Cholla thua'aich
On chrann chointach a bhuain iad
S gur a car a buailte shiol Leoid u uthu
A chiad bhratach fhraoich

div.title: Mac Codrum
div.p:
Nuair a leigeadh ruith do Lochassain
thainig Iain Mac Codrum an rathad
agus thugadh dha an gloine. Thug e
Dh-iarradh air altachadh a dhean
adh. Thug e eurbag as a ghloine us
thuirt e mar so. Gum beann
aicheadh Dia uisge Lochassain

lg.l: S ma s math a dhreach s fearr a bhios
S ma tha e mar seo gu leir
S mor am beud a leigeil as!

div.p:
Bha e uair aig bannais agus an
deigh na bainnse thuirteadh ris gu de
bhannais a bh-ann. "Bannais mhath
bannais mhath. Beagain arain, moran
ime (uime?) 's e an t-uisge beatha (uisge
beatha) bu phailte bh-ann"!
None but a poet of rare excellence could say this

lg.l: Ciod an fhuaira tha shuas sa bheinn
Ciod tha boillsgiodh thall sa ghleann
Co tha tighinn mar shruth treun
Nuair 's toinneach e o sgeith nam beann

div.p:
His no small honour to Stornoway
that a daughter of StorStornoway was the fair
goddess who inspired songs which
are about the most elegant in the Gaelic
language

Its no small honour to Stornoway that one of her
fair daugdaughters inspired some of the most ele
gant effusions of which the Gaelic muse
can best boast If I need hardly say
that I allude to Miss Marion Ross afterwards
Mrs Clough of Liverpool and to William Ross Surely
any language might approve of and every
goddess might be satisfied with such strains
as "Feasgar Luain is mi air chuairt
and Cuachag nan Craobh

div.p:
A Lewis man was going to make a home
& said B fhearr liom gun rorobh nan tein
agam fo sliop s fo shronan NocNochd fear
sitheach an dorust s thuirt e "Clach mhor
aotrom aol & muirsteal (criacriadh ruaruadh
anns am bi clachan) lub us sgrath
us sgolb. Sheall an duine bocbochd s ghaghabh
e eagal." Creach us dile s dunaidh
ors dun Bhinn na thein ors
a bhean s cha rorobhn a shealshealladh orra

Bha Mhuracha mac Ruari
tintighinn a nuas Gleann-chnabhadail
an caolas an Scarp) chual e gach
a taotaobh dhedheth distdithist gaailgabhail orain – te
an Glup an seo & te eile anns
an Sabhal – da sgor mhor creaga
sa ghleann.

Ann an triuastriubhas nan leud

From an old man in Shiabost Lews
who spoke all he spoke in sean fhacail

Iain mac Urach ic Ailein (Morison)
in Siabost had a sentservant girl who refused
to go to the well alone. Why? I see something in
the well. He went himself. When he liftlifted
the water – a fellow cautcaught him & put him
down Leig eir mo chois mi. Cha
ligleig gus an innis uthu dhomh ni sin?
cas is cruaicruaidh an so uthu si. An ta chan
e ach cumail suas na h uislse
dhe aineoin. Go to Stornoway & meet
MacConnich Bhra'ainBhrathain on landglanding
Take him ashore & ask you iarrtas
Siatar na h-Airne fad 3 blianbliadhna
& come back here again. He got
Siatar & made ricks. He made
3 ministers of 3 sons & a clarsair
of another An Clarsair Dall
(Ruary Dall) & said that the latter
was the 3 others in He
sent him to Ireland. He was with
Macleoid Dunvegain. He came
to see his mothmother. She did not know
him. Tha 'n lalatha n diugh fuar thig
a nuas s diandianamh do gharra cha tig fuacfuachd
gu'n tig earrach cha tig cruas no
cruaicruaidh ghaillion 's ann eir eigin
sa dh-aineoin dh-amicheas
bean a ciad leana (fhein)
Chuir Iain mar am fios eir daoine
coincoinneamh gu dire-bhuanadireadh-bhuana. Dh falbhDh fhalbh iad mun
taine e dhachdhachaidh. Naraich uthu mi os bhan
– dh falbhdh fhalbh na daoine – Nise bhean

Dheanain ogol gad reachreachadh ad eug

div.title: An t Eilean Uaine
div.p:
A Bute man Mac Eoin, was coming frfrom
Bute & Loch a roag Harris = was driven
off Barra & drifted. He was suspsuspicious of the
ground so he sounded & found 10 fathfathoms
He put out anchor & in the morgmorning
found a great deal of fraic south
shore of the isle 12 & 12 milsmiles. There was
a ford there so he set to fish & got a great many
salmon breac they were thick in the ford
He traversed throuthrough the isle & found it green
& all under his knees frozen with honey
This was then the EilenEilean Uaine. Then
came the next storm & drove him to
Eirinn. Where he sold the salmon
He then set off again to find the
isle took his course and althoalthough
he was certain he sailesailed
oftimes over it never saw it agnagain
The reef of Rockhall is 12 & 12 milsmiles
& full of old iron & chains. Mac
Eoin spent all his means in
search of the green isles – No inhabi
tants. Green & beautiful isle
A bell was placed on Rocabarru

lg.l: Tha mismise eir an sgeir ris an can aid Rockall
S mi chuile mur lan a soundigeadh
G eu'abheughabh a mach toirt caismean do chach
Fanaibh gu h-aird o'na chursa-sa
Mun d fhuaireadh a mach mi
Chuir mi pailteas gu bas
S bha iomadach mairmathair iondraineachionndrainneach
Mo N mhollacmhollachd 's cha cheil mi
Air fear a chuir lamh
Nam leidleithid be phlaiphlaigh san duaichduthaich e
